text.value: @.../clintonr/WorkHard/testng.xml unable to access class in this file

I notice the issue in your testng.xml file. The `<class name=""/>` element is empty, which means TestNG doesn't know which class to run the tests from.
To fix this, you need to specify the full class name (ParallelTests) in the testng.xml file. Here's the corrected version:
```xml <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <suite name="Suite" parallel="methods" thread-count="2"> <test name="Tests"> <parameter name="browser" value="chrome"/> <classes> <class name="ParallelTests"/> </classes> </test> </suite> ```
If your ParallelTests class is in a package, you'll need to include the full package name, like this: ```xml <class name="com.example.ParallelTests"/> ```
Also, make sure that: 1. The class name matches exactly with your test class name (case-sensitive) 2. If your test class is in a package, include the full package path 3. The test class is in your project's test classpath
This should resolve the "unable to access class" issue.
